data.taskTitle: when agents start a new task do they review prior tasks?
when agents start a new task do they review prior tasks?
data.approach: Add a new step to /squad:start workflow that reviews recent closed tasks (last 7 days or last 50 tasks) to find potential duplicates or related work. Will use bd search command with date filters and output relevant matches for agent to consider before starting work.

data.taskTitle: when agents start a new task do they review prior tasks?
summary: Added new Step 5 (Review Prior Tasks) to /squad:start workflow
Step searches for related/duplicate tasks using bd search with date filters
Provides guidance on how to act on findings (duplicates, related work, in-progress tasks)
Renumbered subsequent steps (Conflict Detection → Step 6, Start Task → Step 7, Emit Signals → Step 8)
Updated What This Command Does section to include review prior tasks
reviewFocus: Verify the new step documentation is clear and actionable for agents

summary: Investigated potential improvements for task review mechanism during task initiation
Mapped out potential strategy for reviewing recent task history before starting new work

suggestedTasks.title: Implement Task History Review Mechanism for Agent Workflow
suggestedTasks.description:
Create a function in /squad/commands/squad/start.md that retrieves and reviews the last 100 tasks or week's worth of work before task initialization. The mechanism should check for task duplications, identify potential overlaps, and suggest related previous work to prevent redundant efforts.

The implementation should include filtering logic, a lightweight comparison algorithm, and a summary generation step for presenting relevant historical context to the agent.
suggestedTasks.reason: Discovered during initial task exploration to improve workflow efficiency

gotchas: Ensuring performance with large task histories

documentationNeeds: Update agent workflow documentation to explain new task review mechanism
